intro: Bunium caroides, commonly known as the wild fennel or sea fennel, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its aromatic, feathery leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and rocky soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its seeds are small, dry, and often used in traditional medicine. Bunium caroides is also valued for its culinary uses, similar to other members of the carrot family.
